net.joala.condition
Interface Condition<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the value which will be verified
All Known Subinterfaces:
BooleanCondition, FailSafeCondition<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultBooleanCondition, DefaultCondition
public interface Condition<T>

A test condition to wait for using a given timeout. If the condition does not become true within time exceptions will be thrown.

Since:
2/24/12

Method Summary
 void assertEquals(T expected)
           Assert that the condition evaluates to the expected value within a given time.

          Conditions need to implement this method to return the value which will be checked.

Method Detail

get

@Nullable
T get()
Conditions need to implement this method to return the value which will be checked.

Returns:
the value
Throws:
ExpressionEvaluationException - when the actual value cannot be evaluated. Consider calling any of the await or assume methods to wait for the value to become available.
See Also:
Expression.get()

await

@Nullable
T await()

Retrieve the result of the condition as soon as it is evaluated without any exception.

Returns:
the retrieved value
Throws:
WaitTimeoutException - if a value could not be retrieved in time

await

@Nullable
T await(@Nonnull
                 org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super T> matcher)

Wait for the condition value until it fulfills the given matcher and return it.

Parameters:
matcher - matcher to use
Returns:
the value which fulfills the given matcher
Throws:
WaitTimeoutException - if a value could not be retrieved in time

withTimeoutFactor

@Nonnull
Condition<T> withTimeoutFactor(@Nonnegative
                                       double factor)
Sets a factor to speed up or slow down tests. If < 1.0 the tests will speed up at least for failures while a number > 1.0 increases the time to wait for the condition by the given factor.

Parameters:
factor - factor by which to increase the timeout for this condition
Returns:
a self-reference.

withMessage

@Nonnull
Condition<T> withMessage(@Nullable
                                 String message)
The message to print on failure.

Parameters:
message - message with debugging hints; null to remove the message
Returns:
self-reference
